text: I'm excited to share with you something
really great I'm doing a whole week of
cooking and to start off with I'm making
a Mexican hot chocolate cookie it's a
cinnamon II slightly spicy chocolate
cookie that I think you guys are going
to all love and want to make for all
your friends and family start off by
whisking or sifting your ingredients two
and a quarter cups of all-purpose flour
today I'm using a sieve to sift my
ingredients so you just Pat it through
it does the same thing as those
old-fashioned flour sifters just gets
any lumps out add a half a cup of cocoa
powder two teaspoons of cream of tartar
a teaspoon of baking soda the acidic
ingredient in here that this is for is
the cocoa powder and half a teaspoon of
salt coarse salt whisk your dry
ingredients nicely you see there's some
lumps in there from the cocoa powder
which is why I'm sifting it instead of
just whisking which is what I would
normally do like to make sure there's no
little pockets of bitterness because it
would be kind of bitter if you got a
pocket of that cocoa powder in my mixer
I have two sticks of room temperature
unsalted butter and one and a half cups
of granulated sugar cream it up you also
need two large eggs I'm gonna crack them
into a bowl to start off with so that I
don't accidentally get any shell add
your eggs to the creamed butter mixture
one at a time putting your eggs into a
little bowl before you add a care mix is
just a safety measure so that you don't
get a piece of shell or rotten egg
your mixture you'll think it's a silly
thing to do until that one time that you
have something in your egg that you
don't want it's happened scrape down
your bowl and then you can add your dry
ingredients I haven't added all of it
yet I just want to get some of it
combined because it's pretty fly away
with good aim you can just dump the rest
of it in there and then go ahead and
beat until everything is fully combined
not too fast I have to do a combination
of SuperDuper simple and like slightly
more elaborate cookies for the holidays
that way I don't get burnt out but you
get a nice variety the batter is done
but we're not completely done with this
cookie yet take it off
what you want to do for the final touch
of this cookie is roll it in some
cinnamon sugar I have a quarter cup of
sugar two teaspoons of cinnamon and then
if you want to it's optional but I kind
of like it a half a teaspoon of chili
powder and also add a little bit of bite
to your cooking you don't have a lot of
spicy friends you can leave it out then
just scoop heaping tablespoons straight
into the cinnamon sugar or you can roll
it slightly into a ball before you put
it into the sugar and then onto
parchment lined baking sheets you want
to space them about three inches apart
have your oven preheating to 400 degrees
for this cooking these are a great
cookie because you can store them at
room temperature for up to a week but if
you wanted to make them ahead and freeze
them that would be fantastic and then
you can take them out when you're ready
to serve them bake them until they've
spread and cracked a little bit on top
that'll take about ten minutes when your
cookies are done of course you want to
let them cool before you serve them I'm
arranging them but all I'm thinking
about is tasting them so let me just
take a break from my arranging to have a
little bite a little bit of spice a
little bit of cinnamon mmm it's so great
it's like the perfect cookie and the
perfect start to my all cookie week
happy holidays
you
